question_text: An organization uses internal DNS servers that cache external query results. What potential issue can arise if the DNS cache becomes corrupted?
answer_options: Users will be redirected to the wrong DHCP server
All local DHCP leases will be revoked
Clients may be directed to incorrect or unreachable IP addresses
Reverse DNS lookups will bypass DNS resolution
correct_answer: Clients may be directed to incorrect or unreachable IP addresses
explanation: A corrupted DNS cache can cause clients to receive outdated or incorrect IP mappings, leading to connection failures or potential security issues.
